results.title: La Balance (S)
results.creator_credit: Bob Swaim, Films A2 and Les Film Ariane
results.brief_description: Heightened crime and increased prosititution in the streets of Paris, force the criminal investigation department to set up a special unit of police called the Territorial Brigades. Their only hope of penetrating the French Maffia is through a network of informers but the perfect informer is killed and another must be found from the pimps and prostitutes of the French underground. Voted the best film of the year in France at the time of its release, La Balance is a world of violence where only the tough survive. This version is dubbed in English.

results.title: The Taming of the shrew
results.brief_description: Petruchio, a poor gentleman from Verona, finds a rich but shrewish wife, Kate in Padua. Their stormy relationship takes a different turn when Petruchio wagers that Kate is the most obedient of wives. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Cyril Cusack, Michael Hordern and Michael York.

results.title: Manganinnie (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Daphne Crooks, John Honey, Robert Hynard, Ross Hamilton, Gilda Baracchi and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Manganinnie, fleeing the Aboriginal genocide of 1830 in Tasmania, rescues a tiny lost white child. Together they find compassion, love and a bond that delivers them from desperation, loneliness and the terror of pursuit. Based on the novel by Beth Roberts with music by Peter Sculthorpe and a script by Ken Kelso.

results.title: Fritz the cat (E)
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bakshi, Steve Krantz and Fritz Productions for Aurica Finance Co
results.brief_description: The X-rated cartoon based on the characters from Robert Crumb’s comic strip became the animated world’s Portnoy’s Complaint, being the first animated feature in the history of motion pictures to contain nudity and four-letter words. Since its release, it has become an adult “classic” - a film everyone wants to see simply because it was naughty and often banned. In the 1960’s flower power era of sex, drugs and rock and roll, Fritz is the coolest cat in New York - poet, muso, dope-smoker and sex hound. In his East village apartment, he and his band engage in an orgy and are raided by the Police. He sets fire to his school, incites the local blacks to riot against white oppression and then leaves the Big Apple for the open road where he becomes ensnared by terrorist bikies! Features a rock musical especially written for the film and the voices of Skip Hinnant, Rosetta LeNoire, John McCurry and Phil Seuling.

results.title: Gorky Park
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Gene Kirkwood, Howard W. Koch, Eagle Associates and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Relentlessly thrilling from its shocking beginning to its spine-chilling end. William Hurt is a Russian Police Inspector investigating a ruthless triple murder in Moscow’s Gorky Park. The victims’ faces and fingers are missing and the KGB is trying to cover it up. Stars Lee Marvin, Brian Dennehy, Ian Bannen and introducing Joanna Pacula. Filmed entirely in Helsinki. The screenplay by Dennis Potter is based upon the novel by Martin Cruz Smith.

results.title: The Running man (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Paul Michael Glaser, George Linder, Tim Zinnemann, Keith Barish Productions and Taft Entertainment
results.brief_description: The year is 2019. All that has survived of the 20th century is television. Television in a new and twisted fashion where the most powerful program on the air is a high-stakes, high-tech game show. “The Running man” is a deadly futuristic cat and mouse carnival in which contestants battle for the ultimate prize - survival! Based on the novel by Richard Backhman, this was rated one of the best action movies of the year.

results.title: Madonna of the seven moons
results.creator_credit: Arthur Crabtree, R.J. Minney and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Maddalena is a rich and respectable wife and mother, who occasionally abandons her Roman villa to go and live in Florence as Rosanna, the mistress of a handsome gipsy criminal. Like the classic horror film it is a drama rooted in sexual repression, using schizophrenia and amnesia rather than the fantastic. “Madonna of the Seven Moons” is based on the novel “The Madonna of Seven Moons” by Margery Lawrence and stars Stewart Granger, Phyllis Calvert and Patricia Roc.

results.title: Mermaids (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Benjamin, Lauren Lloyd, Patrick Palmer, Wallis Nicita, Nicita/Lloyd Productions and Palmer
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder plays a strict Catholic schoolgirl growing up in the conservative early sixties and saddled with the grooviest and sexiest mother in town. A very funny romantic comedy, “Mermaids” celebrates the tensions, love and agonies of mother-daughter relationships. With Bob Hoskins and featuring an outstanding performance by Cher as the free-spirited mother of a very unconventional family. Based on the book by Patty Dann.

results.title: High anxiety (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Crossbow Films and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘High Anxiety’ is a parody of, and a dedication to, the cinema of Alfred Hitchcock. Using the simple plot of a psychiatrist with a fear of heights who arrives to take up a top post as head of the Institute for the Very, Very Nervous, Mel Brooks uses a gamut of scatological, Freudian and slap-stick jokes to create hilarious parodies of famous scenes in ‘The Birds’, ‘Psycho’, ‘Vertigo’ et. al. Cast includes Cloris Leachman, Madeline Kahn and Harvey Korman. The script was co-written by Barry Levinson.

results.title: Little Dorrit
results.creator_credit: Christine Edzard, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and Sands Film (Dorrit)
results.brief_description: Set in the 1820’s, Charles Dickens’ Little Dorrit centres upon Arthur Clennam and Amy Dorrit who find love and happiness within Dickens’ restrictive environment. Part 1: Nobody’s Fault. Arthur is a kind but ineffectual man, bankrupt through speculation and in debtors prison where he encounters Amy whose story is told in Part 2: Little Dorrit’s Story. Amy is a tough clear headed seamstress, cheerfully supporting her imprisoned father. Amy works for Arthur’s mother whom she discovers has been denying Arthur’s rightful inheritance. When her father is released from goal, a twist of fate reunites Amy with her gentle admirer and his fortune. Stars Alec Guiness, Derek Jacobi, Joan Greenwood, Roshan Seth, Cyril Cusak and Sarah Pickering as Little Dorrit.
